data.title: Industry Leader in Access Control
data.meta_description: From our team of access control experts to our future-proof platform, Mercury makes access control smarter. Learn how we can help you.
data.text:
Daniel Gundlach joined HID in 2021 as Vice President, Head of Business Unit NAM – Physical Access Control Solutions. Before moving into this role, he was the Vice President, Global Business Development and Key Accounts at FLIR, leading all facets of the business, including strategy development, product innovation, sales and marketing, and operations. Daniel joined FLIR from Apollo, a United Kingdom-based fire detection company, where he served as Vice President of Sales and Marketing. Prior to Apollo, he spent nearly 20 years at Bosch, including seven years as the Vice President of Marketing and Business Development for their Security and Safety Systems business. He served in numerous roles during his tenure at Bosch Security and Safety in both the United States and Europe, including Vice President of Marketing, Vice President of Business Development, and Chief of Staff to the President and CEO of Bosch Americas. Daniel has a Master of Science degree in Physics from the University of Hannover, Germany and a Bachelor of Science degree in Physics from the University of Rostock, Germany.

Steve Lucas is a business development executive with 25 years of experience in the physical security, building automation, and energy management industries. Steve brings an in-depth knowledge on strategic partnerships, market strategy, and open platform solutions that spans across a wide spectrum of market applications. Before his pivotal role at Mercury, Steve garnered invaluable experience through diverse roles at industry leaders such as Johnson Controls, Tridium, and Honeywell. Steve holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering with distinction from the Virginia Military Institute.

Stephanie Moore White is responsible for financial planning, monitoring business performance, accounting, and internal controls at Mercury Security. Prior to joining Mercury, she gained experience in various managerial financial roles and worked in public accounting. Stephanie holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting from California State University, Dominguez Hills, and a Master of Business Administration degree from the University of Mississippi.

Michael Serafin is responsible for managing Mercury Security’s development team and providing our OEM partners with complete programming support and interface information. Prior to joining Mercury Security, Michael held numerous positions at Lenel Systems International, where he gained a firsthand understanding of customer demands that drive Mercury’s products. A seasoned programmer with a strong background in a variety of operating systems, databases, and development tools, Michael also served as software engineer focused on creating production test tools for Eastman Kodak. He earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering and a Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering from Michigan State University.

Damon Dageenakis (pronounced Dag-i-na-kiss) has spent the past 22 years in the security industry, with 18 of those years bringing high-tech security and technology solutions, including hardware/firmware, software, and SDK/APIs, to market at HID. Damon has managed the majority of HID’s physical-access products, including readers, credentials, and controllers. In his current role, he leads the controller value steam, including the Mercury product line. Damon earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science from the University of Colorado, Boulder.
